intro: Lastrea monosora, commonly known as the slender rock cress, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
